intro: Eriothymus rubiaceus, commonly known as the redstem germander, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing pink to reddish flowers that attract pollinators. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Eriothymus rubiaceus is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to coastal and semi-arid environments.
